title: Ticket #7211: Everything is Terrible, condor_now edition
description:
Jaime just fixed [57671] a bug introduced in the condor_now support, where after a restart, the schedd generates match records which do not have (and never gain) a machine ad. We need to check if other parts of the condor_now support code use the machine ad for anything, and if so, how they handle it being missing.

  • First priority is to make sure the schedd doesn't crash in those cases.
  • Second priority is making sure that the condor_now support code (mostly in the pccc* code) doesn't leak in those cases. (I should also verify that there's garbage collection more generally, since I just don't remember.) It may be best/easiest to accomplish this by checking the match record for a machine ad as part of checking a job ID for suitability, and rejecting rather than trying to deal with it.
  • It would be nice, if the condor_now support code does use the machine ad for something, to change it so it doesn't require it; TJ may have ideas. A substantial fraction of the pool might be inaccessible otherwise.
remarks:
2019-Aug-21 15:43:26 by tlmiller:
The condor_now support code does not appear to use my_match_ad anywhere except for when trying to return the list of match records marked with now jobs.

Four files in schedd.V6/ reference my_match_ad:

  • dedicated_scheduler.cpp -- did not examine
  • qmgmt.cpp -- only one instance of the text was to the match record member, and it was used safely.
  • scheduler.h -- declaration
  • schedd.cpp -- found a few place where my_match_ad was assumed to be non-NULL.

2019-Aug-21 16:29:52 by tlmiller:
Jaime is more familiar with this part of the schedd than I am, so he'll take a look at the places I identified and see if any checks are actually necessary (and if so, what they should do on a failure).

2019-Aug-22 10:43:10 by jfrey:
With the code as written now, I don't see a danger of dereferencing a NULL my_match_ad pointer.

  • Once a match_rec has a non-NULL my_match_ad, the value is never set to NULL.
  • The callers of contactStartd() and claimedStartd() also set a non-NULL my_match_ad.
  • For swappedClaims() and CheckForClaimSwap(), the m_can_start_jobs value in match_rec guards against using a NULL my_match_ad.
  • When making reconnect records after a restart, the dedicated scheduler queries the collector to get the slot ads for its match_rec objects.

2019-Aug-27 12:05:52 by tlmiller:
I think that means we can resolve this ticket, then.
